description: Reading and interpreting graphs, calculating mean, median, mode, range, and data analysis.

concepts.name: Mean (Average)
concepts.description: Calculating the arithmetic mean of a data set
common_misconceptions: Including wrong number of values in count
question_patterns: The scores are {list}. What is the mean?
The average of {N} numbers is {X}. One number is removed. What is the new average?
example_stems: Test scores are 85, 92, 78, 88, 92. What is the mean score?
The average of 5 numbers is 24. If 30 is added, what is the new average?

concepts.name: Median, Mode and Range
concepts.description: Finding median (middle value), mode (most frequent), and range (spread)
common_misconceptions: Not ordering data before finding median
Forgetting to average two middle values for even count
question_patterns: What is the mode of these values: {list}?
What is the range of the data set?
example_stems: Heights are 142, 138, 145, 138, 140. What is the median?

concepts.name: Interpreting Tables
concepts.description: Reading and extracting information from data tables
question_patterns: According to the table, how many {category} {action}?
example_stems: The table shows fruit preferences. How many students chose apples?
From the two-way table, how many boys play soccer?

concepts.name: Working Backwards with Statistics
concepts.description: Finding missing values given statistical measures
common_misconceptions: Forgetting to account for all values
question_patterns: The mean of {N} numbers is {X}. If one number is {Y}, what is the sum of the others?
Adding what value would change the mean from {A} to {B}?
example_stems: The mean of 4 numbers is 15. Three of them are 12, 18, and 14. What is the fourth?
Five test scores average 80. What score is needed on the sixth test to raise the average to 82?
